data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly in Landmark Antitrust Case
data.Description: A federal judge has ruled that Google holds a monopoly in the search market, a decision with potentially significant implications for the company's future.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Volatility Surges Ahead of August Core Update
data.Description: Intense fluctuations in Google Search rankings have been observed, with SEO experts attributing the volatility to the upcoming August core update.

data.Title: Google Discover Traffic to Publishers Increases While Search Traffic Declines
data.Description: A new report reveals that Google Discover is sending more traffic to publishers, while traffic from Google Web Search, News Search, and other areas is decreasing.

data.Title: Google's "Hidden Gems" Update Boosts Visibility for Online Forums
data.Description: Google's "hidden gems" update, rolled out in late 2023, has led to a surge in visibility for various online forums, including Reddit, Quora, and many others.

data.Title: Google Search to Improve Handling of URL Parameters
data.Description: Google is reportedly working on enhancing how its search engine handles URL parameters, potentially addressing concerns related to crawling and indexing.

data.Title: Google Ads Will Not Pause Keywords in Paused Campaigns or Ad Groups
data.Description: Google Ads has confirmed that keywords within paused campaigns or ad groups will not be automatically paused, even if they have been inactive for an extended period.

data.Title: Substack Opens Up Publishing to All Users, Even Without Newsletters
data.Description: Substack has announced that any user with an account can now publish posts on the platform, regardless of whether they have an existing newsletter.

data.Title: Amazon to Use AI to Rewrite Non-Compliant Product Descriptions
data.Description: Amazon is reportedly implementing AI to automatically rewrite product descriptions deemed non-compliant with its guidelines, raising concerns among sellers.

data.Title: Apple Retains Google as Default Search Engine in Safari, Rejecting Bing Switch
data.Description: Despite a lucrative deal, Apple has decided to keep Google as the default search engine in Safari, opting not to force users to switch to Microsoft's Bing.
